title: Dimitar Radev is once again governor of the BNB - BNR
content:
With the votes of 155 MPs in the 240-seat parliament, Dimitar Radev was elected governor of the Bulgarian National Bank for the next 6 years. He was nominated for a second term by GERB-SDS and supported by PP-DB.



During his nomination, Radev defined the accession of Bulgaria to the Eurozone in January 2025 as an ambitious but achievable goal. After taking the oath, the governor of the BNB said that he would nominate as deputy governors Andrey Gyurov /PP-DB/ and Petar Chobanov /MRF, Minister of Finance in the period 2013-2014/.



"One of the most important conditions I set when I accepted to be nominated for governor was that the leadership of the BNB should be elected with broad political support. This is a strong factor for the central bank's independence, including from attempts at unregulated political interference," Radev said.

Dimitar Radev was elected governor of the BNB on July 15, 2015. An attempt to elect a new governor in 2022 failed.

title: Arkham (ARKM) Trading Is Live on Binance - Crypto Times
content:
Recently, Binance announced the completion of the Arkham Launchpad subscription through its official Twitter page. The exchange will initiate five ARKM trading pairs: ARKM/BTC, ARKM/USDT, ARKM/TUSD, ARKM/BNB, and ARKM/TRY, scheduled for 18 July 2023 at 12:00 UTC.

The total token supply for Arkham is 1 billion ARKM, of which 50 million were allocated to Binance Launchpad, accounting for 5% of the total supply at a pre-determined sale price of $0.05.

On 11th July Binance introduce the ARKM token to sale. It has met with unprecedented demand, drawing the participation of 114,454 users committing a staggering 10,182,983.2626 BNB, resulting in an oversubscription rate of 990 times.

To protect users from potential high volatility, Binance has introduced an innovative initial price limit mechanism.

For the first five minutes of trading, the maximum transaction price will be capped at ten times the public sale token price, equivalent to $0.50 for ARKM. After this initial period, trading will continue without restrictions.

As an added benefit for users, the ARKM/TUSD trading pair will offer zero maker fees until further notice, encouraging active trading within the ecosystem.

Throughout the subscription period, Binance carefully analyzed user commitments and calculated the final allocation for each participant based on their BNB balances.

While three participants reached the 300,000 ARKM hard cap, the remaining allocation was distributed to other users, ensuring a fair and inclusive process.

For those who participated, the final allocation details are as follows:

Users who committed 50 BNB received an allocation of 246.1109 ARKM, with 0.05063977 BNB deducted from their accounts.

Users who committed 500 BNB were allotted 2,461.1088 ARKM, with 0.50639775 BNB deducted.

Users who committed 5,000 BNB secured an allocation of 24,611.0879 ARKM, and 5.06397745 BNB were deducted.

Within 60 minutes of this announcement, the corresponding BNB tokens will be deducted from users’ already-locked BNB balances.

Once the deduction is completed, both ARKM tokens and the remaining BNB will be seamlessly transferred to users’ spot wallets, ensuring a smooth transition for all participants.

As Binance readies for ARKM trading to go live, users and investors eagerly await the opportunity to engage with this groundbreaking platform.

With the introduction of the initial price limit mechanism, Binance continues to prioritize user experience and safety while providing a platform for seamless cryptocurrency trading.

title: Dimitar Radev was re-elected as the Governor of Bulgaria's Cenral Bank - Българска национална телевизия - BNT
content:
The current governor of the Bulgarian National Bank (BNB) Dimitar Radev will keep his post after being re-elected for another term in office. On July 18, 2023, MPs voted to re-elect him with 155 votes in favour, 67 against and zero abstentions. Radev was competing for the post with Lyubomir Hristov, a financier proposed by "Vazrazhdane". Hristov received the support of 39 MPs.

Dimitar Radev was elected Governor of the Bulgarian National Bank on 15 July 2015 and has been in office for eight years. An attempt by the ruling party last year to elect a new governor failed. Then there were two candidates - Andrei Gyurov from "We Continue the Change" and Lyubomir Karimanski from "There is Such a People". Gyurov dropped out of the race after information emerged that he did not have a legitimate master's degree. Karimanski, on the other hand, did not receive enough votes to be elected.

Dimitar Radev was nominated for a second term by the largest parliamentary group, GERB-UDF and supported by the “We Continue the change – Democratic Bulgaria”. He has a master's degree in finance, worked for many years in the Ministry of Finance, and was deputy finance minister several times between 1992 and 2001. He has also held various positions in the IMF. If elected for a second term, he will become the longest serving Governor of Bulgaria’s central bank.

Lyubomir Hristov, the candidate of "Vazrazhdane", is also a well-known name in financial circles. He has a PhD in economics from the UNWE, is a former chief economist of the BNB and has held various positions at the IMF. He was the Executive Director of the Central Depository and worked in the field of financial consulting.

Both candidates for governor presented concepts in the Parliament’s budget committee last week. According to the concepts, Bulgaria should be admitted to the eurozone, but while Radev wants this to happen as quickly as possible, Hristov thinks it should wait. The Bulgarian socialist Pary (BSP) withdrew their candidate for the post because they believe the choice was predetermined.

According to the information presented so far, Andrei Gyurov from WCC-DB and Petar Chobanov from MRF will be elected BNB deputy governors.

At the moment, the BNB Governing Council includes Governor Radev, three deputy governors Kalin Hristov of the Issue Department, Nina Stoyanova of the Banking Department, Radostin Milenkov of the Banking Supervision Department and three members - Lyudmila Elkova, Nikolay Nenovski, Iliya Lingorski.

Desislava Atanasova from GERB-UDF presented the nomination of Dimitar Radev:

"Within Mr Radev's term of office, all the objectives set for his election in 2015 have been fulfilled. This is confirmed by the indicators of the financial stability of the banking sector, as well as the country's accession to the Single Banking Council and our acceptance into the euro area waiting room."

Deyan Nikolov presented the candidacy of "Vazrazhdane":

"It is a great honour for us that Dr. Lyubomir Hristov accepted to be our candidate for the post of Governor of BNB. I believe that the central bank needs an objective and independent governor to defend Bulgarian interests." "You will hear from me only good things about the two candidates in terms of experience and education. But we, from BSP, will not support the choice for the following reasons: the ruling society violated the principles of the elections, the winner was announced in advance.," commented Rumen Gechev from BSP for Bulgaria. Radostin Vassilev, independent: "I will not support the nomination of Dimitar Radev, not because of his qualities, but because he is a GERB nominee."

"There is Such a People" (TISP) criticized "We Continue the Change".

Toshko Yordanov, TISP: "Assen Vassilev will look sad when Gyurov becomes deputy governor and they cut off his functions, you are dancing to GERB’s tune and they will cut you off in the end."

According to Georgi Ganev from WCC-DB, both nominations for BNB governor are worthy:
